means: 哀鸣者，啜泣者，悲嗥者，哀诉者

sentence.Network_en: He was a whiner, always complaining of the costs in his Family business.
sentence.Network_cn: 他整天嘀嘀咕咕, 老是埋怨自己的家族企业开销太大了.

sentence.Network_en: And finally, make sure your boss sees you as a winner and not a whiner.
sentence.Network_cn: 最后, 确定你的老板认为你是一个成功者,而不是一名哀诉者.

means.word_mean: 1. a person given to excessive complaints and crying and whining

auth_sentence.content: I never doubted Buck's tale about beating Hemingway at poker and what a whiner Papa was over losing sixty bucks.
